Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] how to extract WARC file ( getting error while
 using arcreader batch file)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=XeZgAOVP2OSevYiUXZrD6bdKxS5KV7aMHT4QWLFQK_lK
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Unsure if you've already solved this yourself, but as an aside I'll 
mention that while we try to retain maximal functionality on Windows, 
the main target for Heritrix is Unix-based systems, especially Linuxes. 
That's what the core team at the IA uses exclusively for crawling, and 
many of the development/project partners. (I don't think any of the 
project committers regularly use Windows, and there are no dedicated 
testing resources for verifying Windows operation.)

While usually things hold up on Windows, sometimes things break and we 
only hear of it -- and receive fixes -- via the community. (When they do 
break, it's most often around 
filesystem/interprocess/environment-variable issues. Also, I doubt the 
Heritrix 3.X checkpointing will work efficiently or perhaps at all on 
Windows without some extra attention; it may be relying on hard-linking 
behaviors that are different on NTFSes.)

So if you have a choice of target system, we recommend a Linux, such as 
a recent Ubuntu.

With regard to the specific problem, I believe the arcreader.cmd and 
heritrix.cmd are doing about the same things to set up the environment 
and Java class-discovery classpath... so if heritrix.cmd is working for 
you, examining the arcreader.cmd to ensure it is behaving the same might 
help. If you discover a fixable problem in the current version of 
arcreader.cmd, please let us know.

- Gordon

On 9/13/12 11:07 PM, badal301 wrote:
> Hi All,
>
> I have crawled one simple website, and it created WARC file. Now i am getting classNotFound exception when i try to extract warc file using arcreader ( from heritrix/bin directory - I have also setup HERITRIX_HOME to C:\heritrix folder). and I have also checked heritrix-commons-3.1.1.jar file, it exists under heritrix/lib folder
>
> C:\heritrix-3.1.1\bin>arcreader.cmd
> Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/archive/io/arc/AR
> CReader
> Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader
>          at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202)
>          at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
>          at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
>          at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
>          at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
>          at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)
> Could not find the main class: org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader.  Program will exit.
>
> Starting Heritrix seems to have failed
>
